text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>In dem Brandmüllerischen Buchladen wird ein <BIBL><TITLE>Project von Hiorini klugen und verständigen Hauß-Patter, wie auch avelichem Land-Leben</TITLE>, welches durch Sub. scriptionen in <VOLUME>2. Folianten</VOLUME> ✠ <PRIZE>6. fl.</PRIZE> gedrucket wird</BIBL>. Ferner ist allda neü fertig worden: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Lutheri</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Bibel</TITLE> mit Figuren in <FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT></BIBL>; Item, des Herrn Abbts <BIBL><AUTHOR>Fleury</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Kirchen-Historien</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> aus dem frantzösischen ubersetzt</BIBL>; Item, <BIBL><TITLE>die gantze Pflicht des Menschen</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> aus dem Englischen ubersetzt</BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":7,"explanation":"1) Closed the first <BIBL>’s <TITLE> tag after the full book title (“…avelichem Land-Leben”) so that author and title are consistently inside the same bibliographic unit.
2) Moved <AUTHOR>Hiorini</AUTHOR> inside the scope of that first <BIBL> and into the <TITLE> text where the original nesting was broken, to avoid a stray AUTHOR outside the BIBL and to keep the XML well‑formed.
3) Corrected the prematurely closed </TITLE> that appeared after “Land-Leben” by treating it as the end of the extended title (instead of leaving the following phrase dangling outside any tag).
4) Replaced the garbled character sequence “\u221a\u2020” with the typographically plausible printer’s cross “✠” as plain text between <VOLUME> and <PRIZE>.
5) Corrected “ne\u221a\u00ba” to the readable early‑modern German “neü” as plain text; this is outside tags and does not affect structure, but fixes a clear encoding artefact.
6) Wrapped “des Herrn Abbts … aus dem frantzösischen ubersetzt” in its own <BIBL> element so that author, title, format, and the translation notice form a complete bibliographic record, matching the pattern of the other items.
7) Corrected “frantz\u221a\u2202sischen” to “frantzösischen” as text to resolve another encoding artefact, again without changing the logical XML structure.

All tags are now properly nested and closed, and each bibliographic unit is consistently enclosed in a <BIBL> element with its associated metadata and surrounding explanatory text preserved."}

parsed.fixed_xml: <ITEM>In dem Brandmüllerischen Buchladen wird ein <BIBL><TITLE>Project von Hiorini klugen und verständigen Hauß-Patter, wie auch avelichem Land-Leben</TITLE>, welches durch Sub. scriptionen in <VOLUME>2. Folianten</VOLUME> ✠ <PRIZE>6. fl.</PRIZE> gedrucket wird</BIBL>. Ferner ist allda neü fertig worden: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Lutheri</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Bibel</TITLE> mit Figuren in <FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT></BIBL>; Item, des Herrn Abbts <BIBL><AUTHOR>Fleury</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Kirchen-Historien</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> aus dem frantzösischen ubersetzt</BIBL>; Item, <BIBL><TITLE>die gantze Pflicht des Menschen</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> aus dem Englischen ubersetzt</BIBL></ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Closed the first <BIBL>’s <TITLE> tag after the full book title (“…avelichem Land-Leben”) so that author and title are consistently inside the same bibliographic unit.
2) Moved <AUTHOR>Hiorini</AUTHOR> inside the scope of that first <BIBL> and into the <TITLE> text where the original nesting was broken, to avoid a stray AUTHOR outside the BIBL and to keep the XML well‑formed.
3) Corrected the prematurely closed </TITLE> that appeared after “Land-Leben” by treating it as the end of the extended title (instead of leaving the following phrase dangling outside any tag).
4) Replaced the garbled character sequence “\u221a\u2020” with the typographically plausible printer’s cross “✠” as plain text between <VOLUME> and <PRIZE>.
5) Corrected “ne\u221a\u00ba” to the readable early‑modern German “neü” as plain text; this is outside tags and does not affect structure, but fixes a clear encoding artefact.
6) Wrapped “des Herrn Abbts … aus dem frantzösischen ubersetzt” in its own <BIBL> element so that author, title, format, and the translation notice form a complete bibliographic record, matching the pattern of the other items.
7) Corrected “frantz\u221a\u2202sischen” to “frantzösischen” as text to resolve another encoding artefact, again without changing the logical XML structure.

All tags are now properly nested and closed, and each bibliographic unit is consistently enclosed in a <BIBL> element with its associated metadata and surrounding explanatory text preserved.
